metadata.Title: CVE-2020-35111 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low.
metadata.Description:
When an extension with the proxy permission registered to receive <all_urls>, the proxy.onRequest callback was not triggered for view-source URLs. While web content cannot navigate to such URLs, a user opening View Source could have inadvertently leaked their IP address. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 84, Thunderbird < 78.6, and Firefox ESR < 78.6.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-35111` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 84.0+build3-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '84.0+build3-0ubuntu2').
thunderbird package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
